issue.title: [Tech]: Remove need to use backend session store
issue.body: The session store is not used for much, beside storing userId, oauth state, last_ldap_sync. We could remove this dependency and store these in a signed cookie instead.

@@ -217,3 +217,23 @@ tags | Optional field name to use for event tags as a comma separated string.
 
 Time series queries should work in alerting conditions. Table formatted queries is not yet supported in alert rule
 conditions.
+
+## Configure datasource with provisioning
+
+Its now possible to configure datasources using config files with Grafanas [provisioning system](/administration/provisioning/#datasources).
+Here are some examples of how you can configure the Cloudwatch datasource using configuration.
+
+```yaml
+apiVersion: 1
+
+datasources:
+  - name: Postgres
+    type: postgres
+    url: localhost:5432
+    database: grafana
+    user: grafana
+    password: password
+    jsonData:
+      sslmode: "disable" # disable/require/verify-ca/verify-full

issue.title: Unable to add graphite functions in the latest build
issue.body:
Hi there. I faced quite weird issue while was trying to upgrade grafana version. It's not possible to add functions to the query (there is no button for it). Chrome console contains the following error message:
```
Error: [$injector:unpr] Unknown provider: tProvider <- t <- graphiteAddFuncDirective
```
It's still possible to add function manually in edit mode so the issue is not very critical for me. The strangest thing in this situation is that I can't reproduce the issue in development mode. I can reproduce it only with grafana-server launched.
My current branch is at b41370ca498816f444363ed7511dced638dc54f6

issue.title: [Feature request] Multiple alerts per graph
issue.body:
As per http://docs.grafana.org/alerting/rules/, Grafana plans to track state per series in future releases.
- "If a query returns multiple series then the aggregation function and threshold check will be evaluated for each series. What Grafana does not do currently is track alert rule state per series." and 
- "To improve support for queries that return multiple series we plan to track state per series in a future release"

But it seems like there can be use cases where we have graphs containing set of metrics for which different sets of alerts are required. This is slightly different from "Support per series state change" ( https://github.com/grafana/grafana/issues/6041 ) because
1.  The action (notifications) can be different. 
2. Also, tracking separate states of an alert is not always preferred (as the end-user would need to know the details behind the individual states ) vs just knowing if alert is triggered.


Grafana version = 4.x

comment.body: I've been trying to use Grafana + Influx for sensor networks.  The dashboards work pretty well, except for alerts.  I need to be alerted when Sensor123 exceeds a certain threshold.   I don't need a chart for that, just an alert.  Also, I need to potentially have 1000s of sensors.  I can setup an alert if "any" sensor exceeds the threshold but I need to know which one(s) is/are alerting.  I have dashboards setup with template variables to view a specific sensor, but I can't add an alert for a template variable.  For testing, I just setup a handful of alerts for a handful of sensors in an extra dashboard that no one looks at, but moving forward I need a different solution for alerts.

issue.title: [bug] Timestamps in CSV export for UTC dashboard are in local time
issue.body:
**What Grafana version are you using?** 5.0.1 
**What datasource are you using?** InfluxDB
**What OS are you running grafana on?** Linux

**What did you do?**
In a dashboard that's set to display charts in UTC, I did a CSV export. In the export, "Time Date Format" was kept set to the default `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ`

**What was the expected result?**
I expected the CSV export to contain ISO 8601 timestamps in UTC, e.g. `2018-03-26T19:14:00Z`.

This is indeed the behavior on an older Grafana 4.3 instance I was running previously, from where this dashboard was imported.

**What happened instead?**
The CSV export contained timestamps in local time, including timezone offset. E.g. `2018-03-26T15:14:00-04:00`. Attempts to work around this, such as removing the `Z` from the "Time Date Format" simply removed the timezone offset (e.g. leaving `2018-03-26T15:14:00` in local time).

This behavior persists whether exporting series as rows or columns, and no matter whether "Excel CSV Dialect" is ticked or not.

This behavior is also described in https://github.com/grafana/grafana/issues/10497, but somehow tagged as a "feature request". I believe it to be a bug, based on the following factors:
- Probably unintended change in behavior with respect to Grafana 4
- `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ` denotes the ISO 8601 format for UTC time. The `Z` should not ordinarily be interpreted as "timezone offset" - though I appreciate there is some ambiguity here

comment.body:
So regarding moment and utc we're already using the following throughout the code base for formatting:

Utc format:
`moment.utc(<epoch>).format(...)`

Local time format:
`moment(<epoch>).format(...)`

issue.title: Get organisation for some users returns empty result (ldap+auth.poxy config)
issue.body:
Hi all,


When I login with new user, I fall into -1 org (auth.proxy + LDAP config) on 1st log.
Problem is that I sometimes can't get out of this org, because some of my users does not seems to have another org declared in grafana, despite fact that LDAP & ldap.toml configuration are OK.
That seems to be random problem, some users can change org, and other can't.

Example : 


```
#User exists
curl -s -XGET "http://127.0.0.1:3000/api/users/lookup?loginOrEmail=xxx@xxx.com" -u "xxx:yyy"
{
   "isGrafanaAdmin" : false,
   "name" : " 7164",
   "email" : "xxx@xxx.com",
   "theme" : "",
   "id" : 113,
   "orgId" : -1,
   "login" : "xxx@xxx.com"
}

As you can see, user falls into -1 org ...

#Org exists
curl -s -XGET "http://127.0.0.1:3000/api/orgs/7164" -u "xxx:yyy" | json_pp   
{
   "address" : {
      "city" : "",
      "address1" : "",
      "state" : "",
      "country" : "",
      "address2" : "",
      "zipCode" : ""
   },
   "id" : 7164,
   "name" : "7164"
}

#If I check user orgs, I see this is empty, it should display user's org "7164" according to ldap config.
curl -s -XGET "http://127.0.0.1:3000/api/users/113/orgs" -u "xxx:yyy"
[]

#With some other users, I have correct group
curl -s -XGET "http://127.0.0.1:3000/api/users/97/orgs" -u "xxx:yyy"
[{"orgId":7023,"name":"7023","role":"Viewer"}]

#So if I try to change user org ID, this does not works (that seems logic)
curl -XPOST "http://127.0.0.1:3000/api/users/113/using/7164" -u "xxx:yyy"
{
   "message" : "Not a valid organization"
}

#ldap.toml group mapping
[[servers.group_mappings]]
group_dn = "cn=7164,ou=CustomersGroups,dc=xxx,dc=com"
org_role = "Viewer"
org_id = 7164


#And LDAP search which is return correct result (same group defined in ldap.toml)
ldapsearch -x -D cn=admin,dc=xxx,dc=com -w "xxx:yyy" -b ou=CustomersGroups,dc=xxx,dc=com AccountID=7164 member 

 7164, CustomersGroups, xxx.com
dn: cn=7164,ou=CustomersGroups,dc=xxx,dc=com
member: uid=xxx@xxx.com,ou=Customers,dc=xxx,dc=com

 search result
search: 2
result: 0 Success

 numResponses: 2
 numEntries: 1

```

If I do the exact same procedure with another account, it sometimes works, and sometimes not.
LDAP search logs are exactly the same between one account which works, and another one which does not.

Is there something which could explain this ?



What Grafana version are you using? 4.6.4 & 5.0.1 tested
What datasource are you using? influxdb
What OS are you running grafana on? debian 9 
What did you do? I tried to login with user defined in LDAP group mapping
What was the expected result? Login, ideally directly in correct Org, at least in -1 org but with possibility to switch to correct org.
What happened instead? I can't switch to user org
 
Thanks, thomas

comment.body:
@tsn77130, thank you.

I now use another workaround, using `auto_assign_org = true` and my first `ldap.toml` mappings are:

```
[[servers.group_mappings]]
group_dn = "admingroup"
org_role = "Admin"
org_id = 1

[[servers.group_mappings]]
group_dn = "*"
org_role = "Viewer"
org_id = 1
```

I use the `orgId=1` as group for all our users with viewer permissions. The dashboard will only contain a description, but nothing more. This fixes the issue when logging in for the first time.

But  when a user was active in another org (i.e.: `orgId=3`) and removed from the respective ldap group. At the next login he will be in `orgId=-1`. I use this rewrite rule (apache), but I have to refresh the page once for it to take effect:

```
RewriteEngine On
RewriteCond "%{QUERY_STRING}" "^orgId=-1$"
RewriteRule "(.*)" "?orgId=1" [R=temp,L]
```

Do you have a better solution?

issue.title: [bug] Timestamps in CSV export for UTC dashboard are in local time
issue.body:
**What Grafana version are you using?** 5.0.1 
**What datasource are you using?** InfluxDB
**What OS are you running grafana on?** Linux

**What did you do?**
In a dashboard that's set to display charts in UTC, I did a CSV export. In the export, "Time Date Format" was kept set to the default `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ`

**What was the expected result?**
I expected the CSV export to contain ISO 8601 timestamps in UTC, e.g. `2018-03-26T19:14:00Z`.

This is indeed the behavior on an older Grafana 4.3 instance I was running previously, from where this dashboard was imported.

**What happened instead?**
The CSV export contained timestamps in local time, including timezone offset. E.g. `2018-03-26T15:14:00-04:00`. Attempts to work around this, such as removing the `Z` from the "Time Date Format" simply removed the timezone offset (e.g. leaving `2018-03-26T15:14:00` in local time).

This behavior persists whether exporting series as rows or columns, and no matter whether "Excel CSV Dialect" is ticked or not.

This behavior is also described in https://github.com/grafana/grafana/issues/10497, but somehow tagged as a "feature request". I believe it to be a bug, based on the following factors:
- Probably unintended change in behavior with respect to Grafana 4
- `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ` denotes the ISO 8601 format for UTC time. The `Z` should not ordinarily be interpreted as "timezone offset" - though I appreciate there is some ambiguity here

comment.body:
Thanks @marefr, appreciate the comprehensive guidance! I'll try to find a bit of time to write the patch.

In that respect, I also agree that the most sensible behavior would be to convert the moment.js object to UTC (or not) prior to `.format()`, depending on whether the dashboard is in UTC or not. In this scenario a user can get the ISO timestamp (i.e. same as output from `.toISOString()`) by specifying the format `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss[Z]`, where `[Z]` turns into the literal letter Z rather than a timezone offset.

issue.title: Improve file structure in the grafana repo
issue.body:
* create new folder named `devenv`
* move `docker` to `devenv/ds-docker`
* create folder for provisioned dev datasources `devenv/ds-config`
* create folder for provisioned dev dashboards `devenv/dashboards`
* create bashscript for coping(windows)/symlining(nix) `dashboards.yaml` & `datasources.yaml` into `conf/provisioning`
* move `tests` into `devenv/tests`. (test config files can be moved to `/pkg/settings/test-data`
* move `scripts/benchmark` to `devenv/benchmark`
* move `examples` to `devenv/examples` (or just nuke it)

I would like to rename `scripts` to `build` but I'm not sure its worth it considering all how many paths we would have to update.

comment.body: One of the bigger goal for this is to share datasource configuration and dashboards in dev env. So its easy to get started working in certain dashboard features etc.

issue.title: Templating: Regex on full graphite expended matches
issue.body:
I know this has been discussed in part in https://github.com/grafana/grafana/issues/2160:

I'm trying to limit a template variable query by including the value of a (independent) variable and then using _parts_ of the _full metric name_. Let's have an example:

Given metric names
city1.services.user1.bananas_eaten.count
city1.services.user1.apples_delivered.count
city1.gates.carts_passed.count

I want to capture template variables `$user` and `$city`, where grabbing possible user values is easy:
just a graphite query for `*.services.user*`. Now, I want `$city` to be limited by the `$user`. 

Here I'm stuck. I can ask the graphite API: `https://my.graphite/graphite/metrics/expand?query=city*.services.$user` and use a regex to pull out the values. But how do I do that in Grafana? All I can do is `find` metrics, which only gives me the last node of the metric name.

Can the template query mechanism somehow expose the full metric name so I could decide which values to construct out of it?

comment.body:
+1
This woul definitely help out with our dashboards.

issue.title: Dashboard links don't open the correct dashboard
issue.body:
### What Grafana version are you using?
5.0.3
### What datasource are you using?
Bug not related to datasource
### What OS are you running grafana on?
Debian 9
### What did you do?
Click on a dashboard link
### What was the expected result?
Open the correct page
### What happened instead?
Open another page

Hello,

i'm having problems with the "Dashboard Links"; I'm referring to the links available under "Dashboard Settings" -> "Links".

Suppose i have 3 dashboard named: "1) DASHBOARD1", "2) DASHBOARD2", "3) DASHBOARD3" all with the same tag named "TAG".

In each dashboard i have configured the "Dashboard Links" as:

Type: dashboards
With tags: TAG
As dropdown: Checked
Title: TITLE
Time Range: Checked
Variable values: Checked
Open in new tab: Not Checked

The link of each dashboard showed in the dropdown menu (top right) is:

http://MY_IP/dashboard/db/1-DASHBOARD1i?from=1503597600000&to=1504202400000
http://MY_IP/dashboard/db/2-DASHBOARD2?from=1503597600000&to=1504202400000
http://MY_IP/dashboard/db/3-DASHBOARD3?from=1503597600000&to=1504202400000

while the link of each dashboard in the main navigation menu (top left) is:

http://MY_IP/d/UNIQUE_ID1/1-DASHBOARD1
http://MY_IP/d/UNIQUE_ID2/2-DASHBOARD2
http://MY_IP/d/UNIQUE_ID2/3-DASHBOARD3

When i click on the dashboard for opening "2) DASHBOARD2" the system instead open "1) DASHBOARD1"; The link:

http://MY_IP/dashboard/db/2-DASHBOARD2?from=1503597600000&to=1504202400000

bring me to "1) DASHBOARD1". 

Using the main navigation menu link:

http://MY_IP/d/UNIQUE_ID2/2-DASHBOARD2

bring me to correctly to "2) DASHBOARD2".

There is a bug on how "Dashboard Links" maps, inside the database, the page name to the actual page to load; maybe the dashboard links should have the id in the path like in the main navigation menu to avoid this problem.

"2) DASHBOARD2" was created as a copy of "1) DASHBOARD1", using the save as functionality on "1) DASHBOARD1".

Sometimes also "Dashboard Links" return ad error saying that the dashboard has not been found.

Use B/s instead Bps for Bytes per second

Most places are using bps and B/s for bits and bytes,
ref: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_rate_units
Bps (Bytes per second) isn't a really common used unit the in the wild.

values

add missing value fill code to mysql datasource
added missing cases for DATETIME datatype
adding support for sgl native time datatypes

issue.title: Interval parsing error for intervals values expressed in days
issue.body:
Grafana: 5.0.3
Grafana host: Windows 7 Pro, 64 bit
MySQL server: Maria DB 10.2, Debian Jessie 64 bit

**Background**
My data source is a MySQL table of network ping tests, collected hourly, covering several years worth of data. 

Table Spec:
```
+-------------+-------------------------------
| Field       | Type
+-------------+-------------------------------
| id          | int(10) unsigned
| source      | enum(<list of source hostnames>)
| target      | enum(<list of ping targets>)
| packet_size | smallint(4)
| start       | datetime
| min         | decimal(5,1)        
| mean        | decimal(5,1)
| max         | decimal(5,1)
| %_lost      | decimal(5,1)
+-------------+--------------------------------
```
Grafana Query Spec:
```
SELECT
  MAX(UNIX_TIMESTAMP(`start`)) as time_sec,
  AVG(`%_lost`) as value,
  '%_lost' as metric
FROM `ping`
WHERE $__timeFilter(`start`)
GROUP BY $__timeGroup(start, $interval)
ORDER BY $__timeGroup(start, $interval) ASC
```

**Issue**
The the default set of values for a variable of type **_interval_** is: 1m,10m,30m,1h,6h,12h,1d,7d,14d,30d

However if I select any of the intervals expressed in days, the Grafana query fails and the display chart is blank.

Looking at the chart specification you can see that Grafana's generation of the SQL query fails for an interval expressed in days such as "7d".

It looks as if the `$__timeGroup()` function can't handle intervals in days. As the default intervals include values in days I interpret this as a bug, but if this is consdered to be `$__timeGroup()` working as designed, then please mark this as an enhancement request.

issue.title: HTTP api always based on primary key
issue.body:
### What Grafana version are you using?
Grafana v5.0

### What datasource are you using?
InfluxDB

### What OS are you running grafana on?
CentOS 7

### What did you do?
Created a dashboard without `uid`. It is impossible to delete it via HTTP APIs because method `DELETE /api/dashboards/uid/:uid` is the only one to delete a dashboard and you must provide its `uid`.

Here are keys of table `dashboard`  with `id` being the primary key and `uid` being a normal one. 

| Field | Type  |   Null |    Key    |
|:----:|:------:|:-----:|:--------:|
| id  |  bigint(20)| NO |   PRI   |
| uid | varchar(40) | YES |  |

To avoid any above situation, my suggestion is that most HTTP APIs support methods based on primary key or a non-repeatable  key, under which the only way to operate the dashboard is to modify database directly.

comment.body: @pf23 Glad that helped. in normal cases you should not need to execute this manually, Grafana should automatically in the database migration step. We have an open issue #11090 that hopefully will make the migration logic better of handling errors etc.
